perturbation.original_text: Subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement so long as such individual continues to pay the applicable Subscription Fee.
perturbation.changed_text: Subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement at the sole discretion of the distributor.
perturbation.explanation: This change eliminates the guarantee that a paying customer will remain a subscriber, putting that decision solely in the hands of the distributor. China's consumer protection laws guarantee services as long as they are paid for. This omission introduces a legal risk by contradicting that protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Rights Protection Law of the People's Republic of China Article 11

perturbation.original_text: Distributor will provide customer support in target Territory in a workmanlike and professional manner.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will attempt to provide customer support.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirements of 'workmanlike and professional manner' weakens the commitment to provide adequate customer service. Article 16 of China's Consumer Rights Protection Law mandates businesses to provide truthful information and quality service.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Rights Protection Law of the People's Republic of China Article 16

perturbation.original_text:
Distributor is responsible for complying with all applicable laws, rules and regulations relating to its collection and use of personal information from
users of the Distributor Portal.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will endeavor to comply with applicable laws relating to its collection of personal information.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'is responsible for complying' to 'will endeavor to comply' significantly weakens the legal obligation to protect user data. Article 29 of the Consumer Rights Protection Law of the People's Republic of China addresses the protection of consumer personal information, requiring businesses to adhere to strict confidentiality rules. This creates a legal contradiction with Chinese law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Rights Protection Law of the People's Republic of China Article 29
